intro: Haplopappus venetus var. oxyphyllus, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant features narrow, silvery-gray leaves with a fuzzy texture, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions.
